title: Vulnerabilities
content:
This page gives information on vulnerabilities and how to view them.

Overview

A security vulnerability is a software code flaw or when a system stops responding through which attackers can directly gain unauthorized access to a system or a network. When you import Qualys vulnerability scan results, you can view all vulnerabilities associated with the devices managed in Automation Center.

Lifecycle of vulnerabilities

Vulnerabilities have a pre-defined workflow representing the lifecycle of every instance within Automation Center. Vulnerability has the following metaphases:

  • Draft
  • Active
  • Inactive

The lifecycle of a vulnerability has the following transition phases:

Vulnerability Transitions
Transition phase Transition type Description
New > Define Automatic When you fill in the name, the phase moves from New to Define.
Define > Approve Manual This identifies that there is no default approval plan and moves a policy automatically from Define to Active phase.
Approve > Active Manual/ Automatic Definition not approved.
Approve > Active Automatic Definition approved.
Active > Suspend Manual Suspend policy until you can approve the changes to the rules.
Suspend > Active Manual Suspend policy until you can approve changes to the rules.
* > Retire Manual No active policy implementations reference it.

Draft

The Draft metaphase contains the following phase:

New: Initial phase for a newly created vulnerability, until the instance has the required information.

Active

The Active metaphase contains the following phases:

  • Assess: It determines the severity of the vulnerability.
  • Action: The vulnerability has all the required information for the organization to track. You can attach it to a Policy attempting to fix it.
  • Review: Changes made on the vulnerability that requires review.

Inactive

The Inactive metaphase contains the following phase:

Retire: Vulnerability no longer of interest. Can't attach to Policies.

View vulnerabilities

To view the vulnerabilities:

  1. From the Mega Menu, go to Build>Vulnerability & Remediation>Vulnerabilities.
  2. To view the full details of a vulnerability, navigate to the details page by clicking the entity’s ID.

Filters

Filters help you filter record lists or define filters for a report. To create a filter, see Filters - Service Management.

Vulnerability details

The vulnerability details contain the following tabs:

General tab

Contains general information on the vulnerability, the Common Vulnerability Exposure (CVE) details, and policies attached to it. The General tab displays the following fields:

general tab
Vulnerability field Description
Name The name of the vulnerability.
Description The description of the vulnerability.
Impact Describes the possible consequences that may occur if you exploit the vulnerability.
Solution Offers a suggested solution to fix the vulnerability.
Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) Score The CVSS Score of the vulnerability.
Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) Severity Severity computed based on the value of the CVSS Score.
Severity Normalized severity. None, Low, Medium, High, and Critical are the severity states.
Source Severity Severity provided by the vulnerability scanner.
Source Id The ID of the vulnerability within the vulnerability scanner.
Source A vulnerability scanner from the imported vulnerability (for example, Qualys).
Source Last Update Time Date and time on which the vulnerability was last updated within the vulnerability scanner.
Source Publish Time Date and time on the published vulnerability.
Reason for retiring

Reason for retiring the Vulnerability. Required to change the phase to Retire.
Owner¹ The person responsible for dealing with the vulnerability.
Owning Group¹ The group responsible for dealing with the vulnerability.

¹ If Owner and Owning Group are not visible (for example, in environments upgraded from 24.3), a user with access to Studio must change the Forms for each entity to make the fields visible.

CVE details

The CVE details section contains a list of CVEs associated with a vulnerability. You can select Add Filter to customize the columns of a CVE. Refer to the table below to add a CVE, remove a CVE, and customize the columns of a CVE.

cve details
CVE fields Description
Add You can select Add to add a CVE associated with a vulnerability.
Remove You can select a CVE and click Remove to remove a CVE.
Columns You can add customized columns to a CVE by selecting the filters in columns.

The CVE columns display the following fields:

cve columns
Fields Description
Creation Time CVE's creation time.
Data domains The CVE data domains.
Description The description of CVE.
DisplayLabel The CVE display label.
Id The Id of CVE.
Last Update Time The last updated time of CVE within the source.
Owner The owner of CVE.
Owning Group The owner group of CVE.
Phase Id The current transition state of the patch.
Severity Severity of the CVE. Critical, High, Medium, Low, and None are the severity states.
Source Last Update Time Date and time when you updated CVE within the source.
Source Publish Time Date and time when you published the CVE.
UUID Universally Unique Identifier.

Workflow tab

Shows the vulnerability instance’s current phase within the lifecycle.

Vulnerable Configuration Items tab

Displays the devices that the vulnerability and the vulnerability status affect as follows:

vulnerability ci
Section Description

Vulnerability Status

Status of the vulnerability.
Os Name Name of the operating system.
Port Specifies on which port vulnerability is reported.
Protocol Specifies on which protocol vulnerability is reported.
Result It’s a multi-line content that describes the vulnerability. This field isn't displayed by default.
SSL (Secure Sockets Layer) Specifies SSL is enabled or disabled for the service port.
Service Specifies the service name for the reported vulnerability. This field isn't displayed by default.
FQDN Fully Qualified Domain Name on which the service runs. This field isn't displayed by default.
First Detected Time The time when the vulnerability was first reported. This field isn't displayed by default.
Last Detected Time The time when the vulnerability was last reported. This field isn't displayed by default.

You can customize the columns and select the fields you want to display. To do this:

  1. Click Columns. Service Management displays a list of fields that are displayed in the view.

  2. To add a column to the view:

    1. Select a field from the combo box at the top of the list. For example, Description.

    2. Click Add.

  3. To remove a column from the view, select the column name in the list and click X.

Available Patches tab

Contains a list of patches that are remediating one or more of the vulnerability’s CVEs. For more details on patches, see Patches.

Discussions tab

Displays discussions related to the vulnerability instance.

History tab

Shows the change history of the vulnerability instance.

View device vulnerability status

After you enable the Vulnerability & Remediation capability, the device details will contain a new tab, called Security tab. This displays the vulnerabilities found on the device and their current status.
